id: Todd Blackadder relief at Bath revival as Worcester overpowered up front
paragraph:
Todd Blackadder, the Bath director of rugby, admitted that the desire to end a winless run stretching back to Sept 22 was all too evident in this victory.Three tries from different players and 15 points from the boot of Freddie Burns took Bath above the visitors and into sixth in the Gallagher Premiership.“We wanted a win and we want to be a top-four team,” said Blackadder. “We looked a bit rusty early on but we built into the game and created some really good opportunities. It was a decisive step in the right direction.”Alan Solomons, Worcester’s director of rugby, did not mince his words, saying: “Simply, we had no field position and no possession.
